ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Overall, the teaching assistant for this course was accessible, organized, and able to explain concepts clearly and thoroughly.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Please identify the teaching assistant with whom you interacted most closely _____________________ .
What were the strengths and weaknesses of your teaching assistant
comments: Instructor: Lauren Louise Griffith  I thought that Lauren made really insightful comments when called upon by the professors. She was very approachable, willing to stay after class to answer questions, and all around helpful as a TA.

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: I think it is obvious to students and instructors that the visit to see the Rachel Carson papers could be improved upon. It was an awesome idea for field trip. Definitely, keep doing it! It just needs to be tweaked so students have more time to actually look at the materials. The online component of the class was great. The website worked well and all the files were clearly labelled. It would be nice if the recommended readings also had links to them. People might be more willing to do the recommended readings if they didn't have to hunt around the internet for them. I think the discussion portion of the class was not long enough. I would have liked for the online homework to have been reduced and the in-class discussion time to have been lengthened.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: The field trip to the Peabody and our last class discussion.
I thought it was a valuable experience to be the week's discussant.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: Allowing certain students not to monopolize the conversation.

I thought the online forums where people wrote about the readings to be of limited value. It felt like people mainly talked about personal experiences rather than critiquing the readings/videos for that week. I just don't feel like I learned much from reading the responses of classmates. The discussions were far more enlightening. It's generally tough to have ongoing conversations with people online.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: The online course lectures are tied closely with the discussion section. No discrepancies here.

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: I just think it is important that students understand the degree to which religion and religious thinkers have shaped the modern environmental movement.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: See question 20 above. Also, I didn't know too much about religion and I thought this would be a good way to gain some exposure while maintaining my focus on the environment.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Leading discussion was the skill-building aspect of the class.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Participate often, even if you don't think your comment is "worth" stating.

This course is a fair amount of work. You get out what you put in to the course. The class discussions can suffer from limited class time and a superficial conversations about topics. Everybody reads such different stuff from the Canvas website. This can make it challenging to focus the conversations on one topic. Finally, Professor Grim and Tucker are the sweetest people in the world. It's worth taking this class just to meet them.
